column4: Hi! I'm trying to install Ubuntu (any 8.04 or 8.10 {32 and 64}) on a computer that I have just build, but it hangs at " loading, please wait" after rebooting from another OS and choose "install" . I have been waiting for as long as 30 minuts and nothing else happens. Any ideas. Thanks.
does it work when you choose "boot livecd" instead of install?
did you check the cd for integrity?
hrm... well, could be anything really... you can try an alternate boot cd, see if that works out better for you.
thanks again. But in a quick watch to all those differents kinds of intall methods, that one looks complicated. Do you think maybe it could cause my CPU is not recognized by the kernel?
unless you have something really exotic, that wouldn't be the problem...
haha no, I dont think it is a really exoctic one. it's a Phenom II
should be ok... could be anything else though. if you built your own comp, often poor memory seating causes problems. did you run the memtest?
I'm afraid that the second choice could be the one (foxconn A7DA S)... maybe that... ok I'll see
the boot cd also has a memory test option - so try running that. might take a while, but it's worth it to run that on a freshly built com.
ok looks like I should try that... even if same rig have W7 beta running on it without any problems...maybe linux kernel is as much picky like that!! I will try the mem test though!!
ok, give that a shot, and see what it reports. :) could be all good, you know... no guarantees that that's the problem.
